sectionTitle: B.3: Jain Path of Liberation: Ratna-trayi
pageSubtitle: An Interactive Study Guide for Ratna-Trayi B.3 section

data.tagHTML: The path to liberation (Moksh) consists of a trinity of jewels that must be cultivated together.

"Samyag-darshan-jnän-chäriträni Mokshamärgah"

– Tattvärtha Sutra

items.content: Seeing the true nature of reality without bias. It is the foundation.
The true knowledge of reality, the soul, and karma that compels proper action.
Living according to the principles of non-violence, self-control, and non-attachment.

data.title: Five Internal Qualities (Lakshan) of Samyag Darshan
data.description: Qualities that indicate the presence of Right Perception.

cards.back: Realization that the world is full of sorrow

data.tagHTML: The soul is the living substance within every being, distinguished by its quality of consciousness (Chetanä). We can't see it with our senses, like air or electricity, but we realize its existence through its operations.

data.title: 8 Attributes of a Pure Soul
data.description: Traits of a soul free from all karma.

data.tagHTML:
✨ Pure Soul

Free, blissful, no karma, infinite qualities.

☁️ Worldly Soul

Ignorant, bound by karma, limited qualities, seeks pleasure in materialism.

data.title: The Nine Tattvas (Principles)
data.description: These define the relationship between the soul (Jiva) and karma.

data.tagHTML: The journey of the soul from complete wrong belief to total liberation is a step-by-step process through 14 spiritual stages, or Gunasthän.

events.title: Stage 1: Mithyätva
events.description: Complete wrong belief. Starting point for all worldly souls.

events.title: Stage 4: Samyaktva
events.description: Attainment of Right Faith. Faith Deluding Karma is destroyed.

events.title: Stages 5-7: Right Conduct Begins
events.description: Adopts vows, becomes a lay follower (5), then an ascetic (6-7).

events.title: Stage 12: Vitaräg
events.description: Passionless state. All Conduct Deluding Karma is destroyed.

events.title: Stage 13: Sayogi Kevali
events.description: Attainment of Keval-jnän (Omniscience). All 4 Ghāti Karmas are destroyed.

events.title: Stage 14 & Moksh
events.description: Ayogi Kevali stage (freezes activity), then sheds all 4 Aghāti Karmas at Nirvāna to attain total liberation.

data.title: Karma Destroyed & Quality Revealed
data.description: Match the destroyed karma to the soul quality it uncovers.

questions.question: What is the distinguishing quality of the soul?
Name three of the eight attributes of a pure soul.
questions.answer: Any three of: Anant-jnän, Anant-darshan, Avyäbädha-sukh, Anant-chäritra, Akshay-sthiti, Arupitva, Aguru-laghutva, Anant-virya.

questions.question: What is the collective name for Samyag Darshan, Samyag Jnän, and Samyak Chäritra?
What is the first step in the process of self-realization?
Name two of the five internal qualities (Lakshan) of Samyag Darshan.
questions.answer: Any two of: Upasham, Samveg, Nirved, Anukampä, Ästikya.

questions.question: From a practical point of view, what does Samyag Darshan mean?
questions.answer: To have total faith in the Tirthankars, the Gurus, and the scriptures.
options: To have total faith in the Tirthankars, the Gurus, and the scriptures.

questions.question: Right knowledge means the proper knowledge of the six universal substances and what nine principles?
Name three of the Nine Tattvas.
questions.answer: Any three of: Jiva, Ajiva, Äsrav, Bandh, Punya, Päp, Samvar, Nirjarä, Moksh.

questions.question: Right knowledge is free from which three main defects?
Which of the three jewels leads a person to practice vows and sub-vows?
What is the first spiritual stage (Gunasthän) where every living being begins?
At which Gunasthän does a person attain Right Faith without any vows?
Which type of karma is destroyed to attain Right Faith?
What is the 12th Gunasthän, the state of no passions, called?
At which Gunasthän is Keval-jnän (omniscience) attained?
After all Mohaniya karma is destroyed, which three Ghäti Karmas are destroyed automatically?
Which four Aghāti karmas are destroyed at the time of Nirvāna?
questions.answer: Vedaniya, Näm, Gotra, and Āyushya Karma.
options: Vedaniya, Näm, Gotra, and Āyushya Karma.

questions.question: The destruction of which Aghāti Karma results in the quality of Arupitva (formlessness)?
